Home Inventory System

The Home Inventory System is a home automation project that I built to keep track of non perishable goods using a web app and a CV based barcode scanning station.

The web app is built using Ruby on Rails and PostgreSQL. Item are tracked via upc code and their information is pulled from upcdatabase.com. The barcode scanning station is Raspberry Pi powered and uses the camera module along with the SimpleCV framework for OpenCV and the Zbar barcode reading library to scan the barcode and update the web app database.

Click HERE to see web app deployed via Heroku or HERE to see the code!

findmesnus.io

findmesnus.io is a snus retailer location aggregator and directions app that I built as a fun project for a friend. The app locates your closest snus retailer and provides you with its information and walking directions from your current location.

The app is built using Node.js and Express for the back end, Angular2 for the front end. Nightmare.js is used for webscraping and the Google Maps API is used for providing the directions.

Click HERE to see this app deployed via Digital Ocean or HERE to see the code!
